## define custom median function
plot.median <- function(x) {
  m <- median(x)
  c(y = m, ymin = m, ymax = m)
}

## define custom mean function
plot.median <- function(x) {
  m <- mean(x)
  c(y = m, ymin = m, ymax = m)
}

## Check assumptions

```{r check assumptions}

######################### check for outliers ######################### 
data_df %>%
  group_by(noisy_robot, order, auto_grouped) %>%
  identify_outliers(single_trust)

######################### Shapiro-Wilk test for normality ######################### 
data_df %>%
  group_by(noisy_robot, order, auto_grouped) %>%
  shapiro_test(single_trust)

ggqqplot(data_df, "single_trust", ggtheme = theme_bw()) + facet_grid(auto_grouped ~ noisy_robot, labeller = "label_both")

######################### check variance homogeneity ######################### 
data_df %>%
  group_by(auto_grouped) %>%
  levene_test(single_trust ~ noisy_robot*order)

```


## Fit Model

```{r fit model}

######################### Three-way mixed ANOVA test #########################  
res.aov <- anova_test(data = data_df, dv = single_trust, wid = pid, within = auto_grouped, between = c(noisy_robot, order))
anova_per_auto <- get_anova_table(res.aov)
anova_per_auto

######################### Two-way mixed ANOVA test POST-HOC (noisy_robot:auto_grouped) #########################  
noisy.effect <- data_df %>%
  group_by(noisy_robot) %>%
  anova_test(dv = single_trust, wid = pid, within = auto_grouped)
noisy.effect

```
